ygData.subject: RE: [rest-discuss] AtomPub copy/move extension: [was Amazon S3 tacks a COPY under PUT]
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Aren t WebDAV COPY requests are sent to the source so that content negotiation works? Using WebDAV COPY you can hint as to which variant you want copied.

Subject: RE: [rest-discuss] AtomPub copy/move extension: [was Amazon S3 tacks a COPY under PUT]
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=330023347

Julian Reschke wrote:
> Bill de hOra wrote:
> > The semantics of WebDAV are backways imo - I don't say 
> "copy yourself 
> > to there", I say "copy this to that". Aside from that it seems the 
> > latter
> 
> Indeed. It should have been defined as COPY from, with a 
> Source: instead of a Destination: server. We still could to that.
> 
> > fits closer with how AtomPub currently does posting which is an 
> > instruction to the collection; the clone option I gave 
> above is also 
> > an instruction to the collection.
> 
> Agreed.
> 
> I think we only disagree on whether this should be a new 
> method, or whether it would make sense to extend COPY to do 
> what's being asked for. 
> I think I would prefer making COPY more useful, instead of 
> defining yet another method.

Aren't WebDAV COPY requests are sent to the source so that content
negotiation works? Using WebDAV COPY you can hint as to which variant you
want copied. If you have a Source: header instead of a Destination: header
then don't have any place to put any headers that influence which source
variant is copied. The GETPUT method I suggested allows the client to
provide a separate set of request headers that the destination server can
send to the source server, so that the source server can (but not
necessarily will) choose a variant that is suitable for what the client
wants.

- Brian
